content:
I am not understanding. Here is a suggestion:

  1. copy the backed up profile to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles
  2. click help>troubleshootinginformation and scroll down to 'profiles' in left side and click 'about:profiles'
  3. your profile should appear and you can launch from there. BUT if it does not appear then do this:
    • click 'create profile' button in upper left of screen
    • then, click next
    • then, enter short name for proflie, such as MYPROFILE, click the 'choose' button to locate and select the profile, click finish and launch

At this point, you should be using the new profile. Since the accounts don't work, click 'account settings' and update each as necessary for the new names. Don't forget the SMTP servers also.
creator: davidsk

content:
Your screenshot shows only one expanded profile folder. Are there any more profile folders not visible in your screenshot? Please post another screenshot with the profile folder(s) collapsed.

Also, please post the contents of your profiles.ini file.
creator: christ1

content:
Try to rebuild the index file of the troubled folder.

Right-click the folder - Properties - Repair Folder

Then also make sure you're on the latest version - TB128.3.3.
creator: christ1

content: I have Thunderbird 128.3.3 esr (64bits) and get the message Thunderbird is up to dat. My last donation was on 20 aug 2024 at first I did not know what means the "troubled folder" but then I tried right click the INBOX (postvak in) and after executing your instructions I could read the bad emails. I'm happy with this result because it bothered me for some time and not one of my IT advisers could help me.
creator: H.Compernolle

content: Create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_how-to-find-your-profile
creator: christ1

creator: davidsk

content: First, I have no solution. The problem appears to be something preventing Thunderbird from saving files to the harddrive. You create an account and it works fine, and it's not there on a restart. That happens because Thunderbird was unable to update the prefs.js file. Further proof is that you have many prefs files. I don't know if it's an antivirus, VPN, or what, but there is an interruption to Thunderbird that is causing this.
creator: davidsk

content: First, I have no solution. I can only share that another person shared this problem just a day ago. Puzzling, as I have a GMX account and can see folders. You might try highlighting account, rightclick and click 'subscribe.' The other person found that didn't work either. This might be somehow tied to something done by GMC -- but I have no idea. What interested me is seeing the same issue posted in the same 24-hr period. If I notice anything of use, I'll share it.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks David. I tried this but could not see the new folder in the list. I selected Inbox - the folder above the new one - and clicked subscribe again. This time the new folder showed in the list. I ticked the box and pressed subscribe again and can now see the new folder and its contents. I'm not sure what that has done but it is now working! Thanks for your help.
